modules.description: This module represents a network interface for sending and receiving Ethernet frames. It provides functions to write packets by filling buffers, listen for incoming packets, and retrieve or reset interface statistics. It works with MAC addresses, memory buffers (Cstruct.t), and custom error types, suitable for low-level network communication in MirageOS unikernels.

Mirage_net.Net provides functions for sending and receiving network packets, including `write` to transmit data and `read` to receive incoming packets. It operates on network device implementations that conform to its signature, handling raw packet data as Cstruct.t buffers. This module is used to implement low-level network communication in MirageOS unikernels, such as handling Ethernet frames or interfacing with virtual network interfaces.

Tracks network packet statistics with counters for received and transmitted packets. Provides functions to record packet sizes, reset counters, and maintain statistics state. Useful for monitoring network device traffic and performance in MirageOS applications.

This module implements network device abstractions for MirageOS, providing a standardized interface for handling network I/O with support for sending and receiving Ethernet frames. It includes core operations like `write` and `read` for packet transmission and reception, working directly with memory buffers (Cstruct.t) and MAC addresses to enable low-level communication in unikernels. Submodules track transmission statistics with counters for packets and bytes, allowing monitoring and analysis of network traffic performance. Specific use cases include managing virtual network interfaces, handling raw Ethernet frames, and implementing custom network protocols with precise control over packet data and device behavior.
